# pack

pack < prak? > rack
back < prak? > rück

𒌑𒁀𒀪𒌋 uᵐ-ba-ḫu-u "pack"

𒌑𒈜𒄭𒊒 𒌑𒆦𒋰𒄭𒊒 u2-paḥ-hi-ru packer "gather" ( 𒈜 le'paḥ <> (wolf…)pack) 𓉐 𓂋 𓂻 port

𒄑𒁀𒌅 iz-ba-tu gis-paᵏtu gepackt

𒂵𒁀𒃲𒇻 ga-ba-gal-lu •Gepäck(el) 𓊪 pack 𒁀 box > bulk bag 𓎤 𒂵𒁀𒃲𒇻 (part of chariot, phps.) box

𒁍𒇻 puᵏ-ru pecuāria “livestock”
𒁍𒇻 animals, livestock “Pack”®

𒌋𒌋𒉺𒆪 naš-pa-ku niche…pack 𒌋𒌋𒉺𒆪 storeroom, storage vessel

𒉺𒆥𒁺 pa-qi-du 𒉺𒆥𒁺 carer (for s.o.) ≠ carry pack

wolf … pack 𓃀 𓃥 in ἀλώπηξ alṓpēx “fox” 𓊃 𓄿 𓃀 𓃥 •zäbek < θεπέκ thepék "jackal"

back => pack pa̍k box ⇔ bangs bing bind

Strong PIE root

𓊪 𓂧 𓊃||box, casket| packets > box +++

𓅡𓎡𓀀 das Pack, der Puck, pfuck, pacht, pächter pactum “pact” fixed pāx peace pangō bind *peh₂ḱ- peg *bak- (“stick”)
baculum (“staff”), Latvian bakstît (“to poke”), Ancient Greek βάκτρον (báktron, “staff, walking stick”). Related to beak. βάκτρον (báktron), βακτηρία (baktēría) •ƒpακτ ⇔ “stick” ⇔ pack

𐀞-𐀐-𐀸 pa-ke-we •'thick'? ⇔ παχύς packed

𓄡 𓊪 𓈖 𓃾 | (adj.) fat | 𓊪𓈖 πίων píōn 胖 pàng pinguis ++++ ⇔ 𓃾 παχύς pakhús πιαλέος pialéos по́лный pólnyj
